```{r setup, include=FALSE}

# ** Some code *******

#  From Hadley's ggplot2 book
is_latex <- function() {
        identical(knitr::opts_knit$get("rmarkdown.pandoc.to"), "latex")
}

pdfoutput <- is_latex()

# personal code, 

# figures parameters
#   aspect ratio
a.13 <- 1 / 3
a.12 <- 0.5
a.34 <- 0.75
a.11 <- 1
a.43 <- 1.33
a.21 <- 2

#   width
# == doc line width in inches * security coeff 0.96

doclinewidth <- (21 - 1.5 - 1.5) * 0.3937 * 0.98 
w.11 <-  doclinewidth
w.34 <- 3 / 4 * doclinewidth
w.23 <- 2 / 3 * doclinewidth
w.12  <-  1 / 2 * doclinewidth
w.13 <- 1 / 3 * doclinewidth
w.14 <- 1 / 4 * doclinewidth * 0.99

# #   output width (only pdf)
# one3outwidth <- if (pdfoutput) {"0.32\\textwidth"} else {NULL}
# halfoutwidth <- if (pdfoutput) {"0.48\\textwidth"} else {NULL}
# two3outwidth <- if (pdfoutput) {"0.64\\textwidth"} else {NULL}
# fulloutwidth <- if (pdfoutput) {"\\textwidth"} else {NULL}

# configs prédéfinies knitr::opts_template$set()

.codeR <- paste0( "knitr::opts_template$set(",
                  ".f14  =  list(fig.width = ", w.14, ", fig.asp = ", a.12, "), ",
                  ".f13  =  list(fig.width = ", w.13, ", fig.asp = ", a.34, "), ",
                  ".f12  =  list(fig.width = ", w.12, ", fig.asp = ", a.34, "), ",
                  ".fnorm  =  list(fig.width = ", w.23, ", fig.asp = ", a.34, "), ",
                  ".full  =  list(fig.width = ", w.11, ", fig.asp = ", a.34, ")",
                  ")"
)


eval(parse(text = .codeR))  
              
              
# verif
# knitr::opts_template$get()
# knitr::opts_template$get(".f14")

# Set aliases
knitr::set_alias(w = "fig.width", a = "fig.asp")

# default options
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, fig.width = w.23, fig.asp = a.34 , fig.align = "center", fig.show = "hold")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

Sur 2 colonnes:(4 plots)


```{r geom-basic, cache = TRUE, fig.width=w.12, fig.asp=a.34 } 
df <- data.frame(
  x = c(3, 1, 5), 
  y = c(2, 4, 6), 
  label = c("a","b","c")
)
p <- ggplot(df, aes(x, y, label = label)) + 
  labs(x = NULL, y = NULL) + # Hide axis label
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 12)) # Shrink plot title
p + geom_point() + ggtitle("point")
p + geom_text() + ggtitle("text")
p + geom_bar(stat = "identity") + ggtitle("bar")
p + geom_tile() + ggtitle("raster")
```

* Idem 3 colonnes, avec modèle prédéfini

```{r geom-basic2, cache = TRUE, opts.label = ".f13"}
p <- ggplot(df, aes(x, y, label = label)) + 
  labs(x = NULL, y = NULL) + # Hide axis label
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 12)) # Shrink plot title
p + geom_point() + ggtitle("point")
p + geom_text() + ggtitle("text")
p + geom_bar(stat = "identity") + ggtitle("bar")
p + geom_tile() + ggtitle("raster")
```


4 colonnes

```{r basic 2, cache = TRUE, w=w.14, fig.asp=a.13}
p + geom_line() + ggtitle("line")
p + geom_area() + ggtitle("area")
p + geom_path() + ggtitle("path")
p + geom_polygon() + ggtitle("polygon")
```
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

Again: 


```{r pressure, echo=TRUE, w=w.13, fig.height = w.11 * 1/3}
x1 = 1:6
y1 = sqrt(x1)
y2 = 1 - (x1 - 3) ^ 2 / 9

curmar <- par("mar")
par(mar = c(4, 4, 1, 1) + 0.1)

plot(pressure)
plot(x1,y1)
plot(x1,y2)
par(mar = curmar)

```
